reviews.title: Magical Mallorca

reviews.title: Deserves its top ratings

reviews.title: Enjoy a wunderfull time at finca son jorbo!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have become disillusioned with package holidays and felt there must be somewhere that wasn't filled with tacky Irish bars, no matter what you paid there was no escape and I am please to say there is - Finca Son Jorbo.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We knew there must be such places and the Finca is exactly what we wanted, it met all our expectations. The house is an old Majorcan country house that has been beautifully restored and has four individually designed apartments. Our aparatment (Azul) had a large lounge, four poster bed, large bathroom and private outside terrace where we spent many an evening with a glass of wine watching the stars. In the morning you could look forward to a leisurely breakfast on the patio.
reviews.title: a wee slice of heaven...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owners, Martin and Annie, were very welcoming and friendly and had thought of everything, there was even cool boxes and umbrellas for the beach and nothing was to much trouble - we can't wait to go back and have already booked for next year.
reviews.title: Perfect in every way!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The surrounding area is unspoiled, the local town has made little concession to tourists, menus are in Spanish and very little English is spoken. Go a little farther afield and there are some beautiful old towns which have escaped the ravages of tourism, long may they stay thus. Nowhere is very far away and the best beach on Majorca, in my opinion, Le Franc, is 30 minutes car drive away.
reviews.title: Every thing we hoped for and more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the place to stay if you wish to rejuvenate during vacation. My girlfriend (now fiance) and I went to Majorca to rock climb, wine taste, and chill during the winter holidays and Finca Son Jorbo was the perfect place to stay. Annie and Martin have a gorgeous property in Porreres, which is the town between Palma and Manacor. They strive to meet your every need and they do so and more. My girlfriend was looking for a recommendation on a place to have a Christmas picnic and Annie recommended Cap de Ses Salines, the southern most point of the island. It was the perfect recommendation to the point where I decided to propose to her. Our room, the Azul room was more of a suite than a room with a full equipped kitchenette and sitting area both inside and outside. Thank you Annie and Martin for suggesting the ideal location for an engagement as well as a perfect stay on our vacation!
reviews.title: A Most Suitable Place to Get Engaged

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife & I took a holiday during non-seasonal, mid-November at Son Jorbo, which was recommended to us. Our hosts were hospitable & helpful, and their converted farmhouse proved better than most 4* hotels. The area was peaceful - no children allowed, only cats, 10 at the last count - and the appartments were pleasant, artistic and well-designed reflecting the character of the farm. They were clean and well-equipped, should you want to self-cater. Breakfast, which was sizeable, included fresh fruit & bread, home-made preserves and local cheeses, as well as cereals & yoghurts. Eggs with your ham were also an option. No need to worry about another meal 'til the evening! Practically, a car is useful here - it's about half-hour drive from the airport - tho' there are local buses about 20 mins walk away. Also, this venue would be difficult to manage for SOME people with mobility difficulties because of the varying levels within appartments and public areas. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay, and have it in mind to return in the not-too-distant future.
reviews.title: Hidden Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a wonderful country villa for adults to chill out in. Annie and Martin have created 4 apartments, all so well appointed that we found nothing lacking from ours. We stayed in azul which is so very well designed! The four poster was more comfortable than at home... The public areas are so inviting, yet cool in the heat of the day, even the pool has natural shade. The pc for internet access was a boon for keeping in touch and the library and games well used. Breakfast was a delight, particularly for this picky veggie and was served with loving attention to detail. Porreres is just 5 minutes on the bike (we were totally car-free) and is charming and unspoiled for meals etc with enough for the visitor. Annie and Martin are superb hosts.
reviews.title: Fandabbydosy

aka: Finca Son Jorbo Porreres, Spain - Majorca
description: As the owners of Finca Son Jorbo, we have tried to create the sort of place where we would like to stay. We believe that we offer more than just a bed and breakfast. Rather than having only a bedroom, our 4 stylish apartment suites each have a bedroom, a sitting room, a bathroom, a kitchen and a private terrace, giving you plenty of space to make yourself at home. Finca Son Jorbo is a traditional 17th century Mallorcan house in a rural location with views over the local countryside. The house and gardens offer a peaceful and informal place for grown-ups to unwind and relax without children. Our central location enables you to get to almost anywhere in Mallorca within 1 hour, making it the ideal base from which to explore the whole island.
